Enema, pubic hair shaving and insertion of urinary catheter: 
• None of these procedures is necessary or desirable in the routine management of normal labour.
Routine artificial rupture of membranes (AROM or amniotomy) 
• Amniotomy may contribute to neonatal sepsis and vertical transmission of various infections and should not
be part of the routine management of normal labour.
